alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Espanola Valley; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 19 at 9:47AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Potential for flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, South Central Mountains. In north central New Mexico, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Espanola Valley and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...From 1 PM MDT this afternoon through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. This includes the Hermits Peak/Calf Canyon, McBride, and Nogal Burn Scars, which will be especially susceptible to flash flooding. Drainages that flow into the Espanola Valley from the west slopes of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains will also be especially susceptible to flash flooding due to heavy rain that fell on their headwaters on Saturday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Numerous showers and thunderstorms are expected this afternoon and tonight, some with locally heavy rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Espanola Valley; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
